title: Bug Lang-1
description: When parsing certain numeric strings, NumberUtils.createNumber mishandles edge-case formats (e.g., combinations of signs, decimal points, or exponents). Instead of returning a correctly typed number preserving the intended value, it either throws a NumberFormatException or returns an imprecise value, causing org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtilsTest::TestLang747 to fail.

title: Bug Lang-3
description: NumberUtils.createNumber(String) loses precision when parsing some string representations of large or high-precision numbers. Values that should be representable without precision loss (for example via BigDecimal) are rounded or truncated, so the parsed result does not exactly match the original string, violating org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtilsTest::testStringCreateNumberEnsureNoPrecisionLoss.

title: Bug Lang-4
description: LookupTranslator incorrectly handles lookup sequences when some keys are prefixes of others or when multi-character sequences appear in the input. It may stop too early or apply the wrong mapping, leading to partially translated output instead of consistently replacing the longest matching sequence, as asserted in org.apache.commons.lang3.text.translate.LookupTranslatorTest::testLang882.

title: Bug Lang-5
description: LocaleUtils.toLocale(String) and related methods misinterpret certain locale strings (such as those with underscores, country/variant parts, or edge-case formats). Instead of either returning the appropriate Locale or rejecting malformed input, the method accepts invalid forms or rejects valid ones, causing org.apache.commons.lang3.LocaleUtilsTest::testLang865 to fail.

title: Bug Lang-6
description: The string escaping utilities in StringUtils incorrectly handle Unicode surrogate pairs. When asked to escape a string containing characters outside the BMP, the code treats each half of the surrogate pair independently, producing invalid escape sequences or breaking characters into two code points, rather than emitting a single valid escaped representation. This behavior is exposed in org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtilsTest::testEscapeSurrogatePairs.

title: Bug Lang-7
description: NumberUtils.createNumber does not correctly distinguish between several numeric formats (hex, decimal, scientific notation) when combined with leading plus/minus signs or certain suffixes. Some valid numeric strings are rejected, and some invalid ones are accepted or mapped to the wrong numeric type, breaking the expectations codified in org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtilsTest::testCreateNumber.

title: Bug Lang-8
description: When formatting dates, FastDateFormat ignores the time zone of the Calendar passed into the formatter and instead uses the formatter’s or system’s default time zone. This leads to formatted strings that are shifted relative to the calendar’s actual zone, violating org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat_PrinterTest::testCalendarTimezoneRespected, which expects the calendar’s time zone to be honored.

title: Bug Lang-9
description: FastDateFormat incorrectly parses certain date/time patterns, especially when the format includes quoted literals or specific combinations of fields. Instead of round-tripping between formatting and parsing, the parser returns wrong field values or fails altogether for valid strings, as captured by org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat_ParserTest::testLANG_832.

title: Bug Lang-10
description: For another class of patterns, FastDateFormat’s parser disagrees with its printer about how to interpret fields such as time zone, era, or localized text. Valid formatted strings cannot be reliably parsed back into the original date/time, leading to incorrect or inconsistent Date values and the failure of org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormat_ParserTest::testLANG_831.

title: Bug Lang-11
description: RandomStringUtils can generate characters outside the intended ranges (for example, including surrogate characters or characters outside the specified alphabet) when asked to produce random letters or alphanumerics. This causes generated strings to violate the documented constraints on character classes, which org.apache.commons.lang3.RandomStringUtilsTest::testLANG807 detects.

title: Bug Lang-12
description: Several overloads of RandomStringUtils perform insufficient argument validation. Negative lengths, invalid start/end range parameters, or empty character arrays either produce unexpected strings or fail with confusing exceptions instead of a clear IllegalArgumentException. org.apache.commons.lang3.RandomStringUtilsTest::testExceptions verifies that invalid arguments should be rejected in a well-defined way.

title: Bug Lang-13
description: SerializationUtils fails to correctly serialize and deserialize Class objects representing primitive types, such as int.class or boolean.class. After a round trip, the result may not be equal to the original primitive Class object, or deserialization may fail, which is contrary to expectations in org.apache.commons.lang3.SerializationUtilsTest::testPrimitiveTypeClassSerialization.

title: Bug Lang-14
description: StringUtils.equals(CharSequence, CharSequence) and related equality helpers mishandle certain CharSequence implementations or null handling. In some cases, two different but equal sequences are reported as unequal, or comparisons involving null do not follow the documented contract. org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtilsEqualsIndexOfTest::testEquals exercises these edge cases.

title: Bug Lang-15
description: TypeUtils.getTypeArguments does not correctly infer type arguments for complex generic hierarchies, such as nested parameterized types, wildcards, or interfaces. It may return incomplete mappings or null when valid type information exists, breaking generic reasoning and causing org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.TypeUtilsTest::testGetTypeArguments to fail.

title: Bug Lang-16
description: A different subset of input strings reveal that NumberUtils.createNumber does not robustly handle edge cases such as boundaries between integer and long ranges, or combinations of decimal points and exponents. Instead of selecting a type that preserves value and range, it either overflows, misclassifies, or throws unexpectedly, leading to failures in org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtilsTest::testCreateNumber for those specific cases.

title: Bug Lang-17
description: StringEscapeUtils mishandles certain Java escape sequences, such as Unicode escapes and combinations of backslashes and quotes. Escaping and then unescaping a string does not yield the original value; some characters become double-escaped or corrupted. org.apache.commons.lang3.StringEscapeUtilsTest::testLang720 checks for these round-trip and correctness properties.

title: Bug Lang-19
description: NumericEntityUnescaper incorrectly processes unfinished or malformed numeric entities like "&#12" (missing semicolon). Instead of leaving such fragments untouched, it partially converts them or truncates the surrounding text, leading to corrupted output. org.apache.commons.lang3.text.translate.NumericEntityUnescaperTest::testUnfinishedEntity expects these incomplete entities to be preserved as-is.

title: Bug Lang-20
description: StringUtils.join(char[], …) does not properly respect the start and end index arguments or separators when joining character arrays. In specific cases, the last character is dropped, extra separators appear, or an empty result is produced where a non-empty string is expected. These corner cases are exercised by org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtilsTest::testJoin_ArrayChar.

title: Bug Lang-21
description: DateUtils.isSameLocalTime(Calendar, Calendar) compares instants across different time zones incorrectly by not normalizing or by relying on the underlying time zone offset. As a result, two calendars representing the same local fields in different zones may be treated as unequal, contrary to org.apache.commons.lang3.time.DateUtilsTest::testIsSameLocalTime_Cal.

title: Bug Lang-22
description: Fraction.getReducedFraction(int, int) is vulnerable to overflow and sign-handling issues when reducing fractions with large numerators or denominators, for example values close to Integer.MIN_VALUE. Instead of returning a mathematically reduced and normalized fraction, it may overflow internally or produce an incorrectly signed result, as verified in org.apache.commons.lang3.math.FractionTest::testReducedFactory_int_int.

title: Bug Lang-23
description: ExtendedMessageFormat’s equals and hashCode implementations fail to consider all relevant configuration, such as the pattern or registry, leading to two logically different format instances comparing equal or producing inconsistent hash codes. This violates the general contract for equals and hashCode, which org.apache.commons.lang3.text.ExtendedMessageFormatTest::testEqualsHashcode checks.

title: Bug Lang-24
description: NumberUtils.isNumber(String) misclassifies several string forms, such as hex literals, numbers with leading plus signs, or malformed exponent parts. Some invalid strings are marked as numeric, while some valid forms are rejected. org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtilsTest::testIsNumber encodes the expected classification behavior that the implementation currently violates.

title: Bug Lang-26
description: Under certain patterns, FastDateFormat does not format or parse date and time values consistently, especially when quoting text or handling time-zone indicators. Small discrepancies in the formatted output or parsing of specific fields cause the round-trip to fail, as captured by org.apache.commons.lang3.time.FastDateFormatTest::testLang645.

title: Bug Lang-27
description: Another group of numeric formats, such as those mixing hex prefixes, type suffixes, or borderline range values, provoke incorrect behavior in NumberUtils.createNumber. The method may choose an inappropriate numeric type or silently change the value, violating the expectations encoded in org.apache.commons.lang3.math.NumberUtilsTest::testCreateNumber for these additional scenarios.

title: Bug Lang-28
description: NumericEntityUnescaper fails to correctly convert numeric entities that represent Unicode code points outside the Basic Multilingual Plane. It does not construct proper surrogate pairs, resulting in broken or replacement characters rather than the intended supplementary character. org.apache.commons.lang3.text.translate.NumericEntityUnescaperTest::testSupplementaryUnescaping detects this incorrect handling.

title: Bug Lang-29
description: SystemUtils.getJavaVersionAsInt parses the JVM’s version string incorrectly once more complex version schemes, with multiple dots or underscores, are used. It may conflate minor and patch components or truncate parts of the version, producing an integer that does not reflect the actual runtime version. org.apache.commons.lang3.SystemUtilsTest::testJavaVersionAsInt asserts the desired mapping.

title: Bug Lang-30
description: StringUtils.containsNone(CharSequence, char[]) only checks individual char values, so it does not treat surrogate pairs as single Unicode code points. For strings containing supplementary characters, the method may incorrectly report that none of the forbidden characters are present even when a surrogate pair encodes one of them. This is specifically tested in org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtilsEqualsIndexOfTest::testContainsNone_CharArrayWithSupplementaryChars.

title: Bug Lang-31
description: StringUtils.containsAny(CharSequence, char[]) fails to correctly handle surrogate pairs and supplementary characters. It can either miss matches entirely or signal a match based on only half of a surrogate pair, violating the expected semantics captured by org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtilsEqualsIndexOfTest::testContainsAnyCharArrayWithSupplementaryChars.

title: Bug Lang-32
description: HashCodeBuilder.reflectionHashCode does not detect object reference cycles when traversing fields reflectively. For cyclic object graphs, it may recurse indefinitely or throw a StackOverflowError instead of handling cycles gracefully. org.apache.commons.lang3.builder.HashCodeBuilderTest::testReflectionObjectCycle ensures that hash code computation terminates and is stable even in the presence of cycles.

title: Bug Lang-33
description: ClassUtils.toClass(Object...) mishandles null inputs or arrays containing null elements. Rather than returning an array of Class objects aligned with the non-null arguments and treating null as null slots or rejecting them clearly, it may throw unexpected exceptions or produce misaligned results. This is exercised in org.apache.commons.lang3.ClassUtilsTest::testToClass_object.

title: Bug Math-1
description: The BigFraction constructor that takes a numeric value and a digit limit does not honor the requested limit when approximating certain inputs. For some values, it either exceeds the digit limit, produces a fraction outside the allowed tolerance, or fails with an unexpected error instead of returning a reasonable approximation, as tested in org.apache.commons.math3.fraction.BigFractionTest::testDigitLimitConstructor.

title: Bug Math-2
description: HypergeometricDistribution suffers from numerical stability issues for specific parameter combinations, such as large populations and sample sizes near the population size. Probability calculations overflow or underflow internally, resulting in NaN or grossly inaccurate probabilities, which break the expectations in org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.HypergeometricDistributionTest::testMath1021.

title: Bug Math-3
description: MathArrays.linearCombination assumes at least two terms and uses algorithms that break down when the arrays contain only one element. In the single-element case, it may throw unexpected exceptions or return a value that is not equal to the straightforward product of the two entries, violating org.apache.commons.math3.util.MathArraysTest::testLinearCombinationWithSingleElementArray.

title: Bug Math-4
description: The intersection logic for SubLine in 3D Euclidean space incorrectly reports an intersection point even when two line segments are disjoint, such as parallel non-overlapping segments or segments whose intersection lies outside their ranges. org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.SubLineTest::testIntersectionNotIntersecting captures that a non-intersecting configuration must yield no intersection.

title: Bug Math-5
description: The reciprocal of the complex zero, new Complex(0, 0), is computed incorrectly. Instead of returning a well-defined representation or signaling an appropriate error, the implementation returns misleading finite values or an unexpected exception. org.apache.commons.math3.complex.ComplexTest::testReciprocalZero specifies the correct behavior for this edge case.

title: Bug Math-6
description: NonLinearConjugateGradientOptimizer fails to solve a trivial optimization problem where the minimum is easy to locate. Due to incorrect initialization or step update logic, it may not converge, may stop at a non-optimal point, or may exhaust iterations unnecessarily. org.apache.commons.math3.optim.nonlinear.scalar.gradient.NonLinearConjugateGradientOptimizerTest::testTrivial exposes this regression.

title: Bug Math-7
description: The DormandPrince853Integrator sometimes fails to detect and handle user-defined events, such as zero crossings, at the correct times. Events can be missed, triggered multiple times, or triggered at slightly wrong time steps due to scheduling and interpolation errors, which org.apache.commons.math3.ode.nonstiff.DormandPrince853IntegratorTest::testEventsScheduling checks for.

title: Bug Math-8
description: DiscreteRealDistribution computes cumulative probabilities and sampling behavior based on its support points, but for certain supports it mishandles duplicates or ordering. This leads to incorrect probabilities or inconsistent samples compared to the specified weights, violating expectations in org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.DiscreteRealDistributionTest::testIssue942.

title: Bug Math-9
description: In geometry.euclidean.threed.Line, calling revert() should reverse the line’s direction while preserving its geometric properties. Due to a bug, operations performed after revert, such as point projections or distance calculations, use inconsistent internal state, leading to wrong geometric results. org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.LineTest::testRevert checks that reverting a line remains behaviorally consistent.

title: Bug Math-10
description: The automatic differentiation implementation of atan2 in DerivativeStructure mishandles special cases involving zeros, negative zeros, and NaNs. It may compute incorrect function values or derivatives, particularly when one argument is zero, which is contrary to the numerical expectations encoded in org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.differentiation.DerivativeStructureTest::testAtan2SpecialCases.

title: Bug Time-1
description: A Partial constructed from arrays of field types and integer values does not robustly validate its inputs. When the arrays have mismatched lengths or unsupported combinations of fields, it either accepts illegal configurations or throws inconsistent exceptions. org.joda.time.TestPartial_Constructors::testConstructorEx7_TypeArray_intArray asserts stricter, predictable behavior.

title: Bug Time-2
description: Partial.with() fails when adding or replacing fields whose underlying DurationField has no meaningful range, for example fields that cannot be combined with the existing partial. Instead of rejecting such combinations cleanly, it may insert invalid fields or behave inconsistently, which org.joda.time.TestPartial_Basics::testWith_baseAndArgHaveNoRange checks.

title: Bug Time-3
description: Adding zero years to a MutableDateTime instance around a daylight-saving-time overlap boundary in winter should be a no-op. Due to a chronology and time-zone bug, the local time or offset changes even when adding zero, effectively shifting the instant. org.joda.time.TestMutableDateTime_Adds::testAddYears_int_dstOverlapWinter_addZero exposes this unexpected mutation.

title: Bug Time-4
description: Another Partial.with() scenario mis-handles the replacement or removal of fields. In some sequences of with calls, the resulting partial has duplicate or missing fields, or fields in an incorrect order, instead of producing a normalized, consistent set of fields. org.joda.time.TestPartial_Basics::testWith3 encodes the intended semantics.

title: Bug Time-5
description: Period.normalizedStandard() incorrectly normalizes months into years and remaining months for certain inputs. For example, a period containing months and other fields may be transformed into an equivalent period with wrong component values, breaking the invariants tested by org.joda.time.TestPeriod_Basics::testNormalizedStandard_periodType_months1.

title: Bug Time-6
description: In the GJ (Gregorian/Julian) chronology, dates around the historical cutover, particularly before year zero, are mishandled. Calculations using GJDate near this cutover point can yield off-by-one errors or incorrect chronology transitions. org.joda.time.TestGJDate::test_cutoverPreZero verifies that dates before the cutover are computed correctly.

title: Bug Time-7
description: DateTimeFormatter.parseInto fails to correctly parse a partial representation of February 29 in the New York time zone at the start of the year. Instead of producing a valid date or an appropriate failure, it misinterprets the year or day, leading to an incorrect DateTime instance. org.joda.time.format.TestDateTimeFormatter::testParseInto_monthDay_feb29_newYork_startOfYear checks this leap-year and time-zone interaction.

title: Bug Time-8
description: DateTimeZone.forOffsetHoursMinutes(int, int) does not correctly normalize combinations of hour and minute offsets, especially for negative or large offset values. It may create zones with the wrong total offset or throw for otherwise valid combinations, violating the expectations of org.joda.time.TestDateTimeZone::testForOffsetHoursMinutes_int_int.

title: Bug Time-9
description: A related but distinct corner case of DateTimeZone.forOffsetHoursMinutes similarly mishandles normalization of offsets, for example where the minutes component causes crossing an hour boundary or where sign handling is subtle. org.joda.time.TestDateTimeZone::testForOffsetHoursMinutes_int_int includes this second scenario.

title: Bug Time-10
description: Days.daysBetween(ReadablePartial, ReadablePartial) miscomputes the number of days between two MonthDay-like partials. In particular, it can be off by one around leap years or year boundaries because it chooses an inappropriate base year or fails to account for leap days. org.joda.time.TestDays::testFactory_daysBetween_RPartial_MonthDay asserts the correct day counts for these cases.
